skill.name: chart-generator
skill.description: Generate charts and visualizations from data using various charting libraries and formats.
skill.summary: Generate charts and visualizations from data using various charting libraries and formats.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing example code snippets for chart generation. No executable code, network calls, or file system operations are present. The skill provides templates and examples for creating visualizations using popular libraries.

content.value_statement: Transform raw data into compelling visual stories. Create bar charts, line graphs, scatter plots, heatmaps, and interactive dashboards with professional styling.
actual_capabilities: Create bar, line, pie, scatter, and histogram charts
Export charts as PNG, SVG, PDF, and HTML
Apply professional color themes and styling
limitations: Interactive charts require HTML export for full functionality

use_cases.description: Create sales trends, performance metrics, and KPI dashboards for executive presentations

use_cases.title: Scientific Data Visualization
use_cases.description: Generate publication-ready charts for research papers and statistical analysis

use_cases.title: Application Analytics
use_cases.description: Build interactive charts for web applications and user analytics dashboards

best_practices: Choose chart types that match your data story and audience needs
Use consistent color schemes and clear labels for better readability
Export charts in vector formats (SVG, PDF) for print publications
anti_patterns: Avoid 3D charts that can distort data perception and readability
Don't use pie charts for comparing more than 5-7 categories
Never skip axis labels and units - they provide essential context

faq.question: Which chart type should I use for time series data?
faq.answer: Use line charts for continuous time series, area charts for cumulative data, and bar charts for discrete time periods.

faq.question: Can I customize colors and themes?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides multiple color palettes including corporate, pastel, vibrant, and monochrome themes.

faq.question: How do I create interactive charts for web?
faq.answer: Use Plotly examples to generate HTML files with zoom, pan, and hover interactions that work in any browser.

faq.question: What's the best format for print publications?
faq.answer: Export as PDF or SVG for vector graphics that scale without quality loss, or use PNG at 300+ DPI for raster images.

faq.question: Can I combine multiple chart types?
faq.answer: Yes, use subplot layouts or dashboard templates to combine different chart types in a single visualization.

faq.question: How do I handle large datasets?
faq.answer: Consider sampling, aggregation, or using interactive libraries like Plotly that handle large data efficiently.
